website_summaries.verdict: Comes with an ergonomic keyboard to ease excessive typing and tons of connectivity.
pros: Intel Core processing earns high marks for the slick display screen it supports
Reviews indicate that the device is quick to process
Built in WiFi technology makes it easy to connect from almost anywhere
cons: Slow to start in some instances, but may just require use

customer_reviews.title: Slow, noisy, locks up out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this laptop for three weeks. The hard drive sounds like a distant lawn mower. This thing is SLOW! I have installed NO software on it yet it updates something every day and wants to reboot. I’m trying to do online college college courses with it and it gets hung up in some intimate nevernever land of unresponsiveness. It just locked up again. I’m very disappointed. Did I mention it sounds like a lawn mower? Don’t do it.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Kazman

customer_reviews.title: Blank screen!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the laptop less than two months ago. Used it maybe three times week for Youtube and other videos only. Today tried to turned it on, but to a blank screen! Completely dark/blank while the power and all the other indicator lights were on! Only to find out this is a common problem with ASUS? It eventually turn on after pressing the hot keys... Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: melanie hua

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE!!
customer_reviews.text: I guess buying what seemed to be a good value was a mistake, they are just cheap crap. I bought 2, one stopped working after 9 months, was sent for "repair" it wasn't came right back with the same issue. the other one had the same issue after 9 months of use, wasn't used right away when purchased. The customer service is the worst I have ever experienced, asking the same questions over and over, not helpful at all. DO NOT BUY! if you do good luck, better off using them as door stops instead of contacting ASUS for support of service.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M Karsten

customer_reviews.title: Best budget laptop in the market right now.
customer_reviews.text: I went through a lot reviews before I purchased it. This is a pretty good laptop for the price I paid (on sale). I made the purchase for my friend. I told him to replace the HDD with SSD eventually. The display is crisp. I have Surface Pro 3 (2160x1440) and Dell XPS 13 9350 (3200x1800). I compared it with both them keeping them side by side. Looks good. Hold it's ground. I'll definitely update the review once I get any information regarding battery life from my friend. The laptop is light compared to other 15.6" laptop. Thin bezels gave it a small footprint too. I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kehlevh

customer_reviews.title: First impressions
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today so these are just first impressions. Pros: - sleek and nice texture on lid - acceptable amount of flex - lightweight - fingerprint reader is working well - track pad is accurate - keyboard is comfortable to use - screen looks good Cons - feels very slow (hoping an ssd will fix this) - finger doesn't side smoothly along track pad. There's some unnecessary resistance / stickyness - took literally 5+ hours for Windows update / setup - there's some coil whine type noise but not too loud - the webcam is a bad joke
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Lang

customer_reviews.title: As a budget laptop, this is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this ASUS VivoBook F510UA FHD Laptop for my wife. She does spreadsheets and office work and does NOT play games. I did a bench test using 'novabench' and was surprised with the results. Was ok for a low end gaming computer but was so much better than a budget laptop. The onboard graphics hold it back from playing games but we didn't buy it for that! This computer is lightweight but doesn't feel fragile. Others have complained of keyboard flex, there is a little but nothing to be concerned about. I didn't see anything about Bluetooth or on board camera in the description, but it has both. So far we are very happy with this laptop
customer_reviews.author: Annette G

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop for those low on funds
customer_reviews.text: Awesome laptop especially if you don't have a ton of cash to spend on a new one or dont need anything super high end. I am a casual user, I tend to spend most of my time on my tablet or work laptop. But occasionally do need a laptop for personal use. Given that, I didnt want to spend a lot but wanted something good and this fit the bill. Its super lightweight, fast processor and stylish looking too. Only drawback is the keyboard doesnt light up so hence the 4 stars. But otherwise an amazing laptop.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: affordable and has a nice screen. I installed a new m
customer_reviews.text: Fast, affordable and has a nice screen. I installed a new m.2 ssd and some extra ram as soon as I got it. It is not difficult at all to remove the bottom cover. Just remember to remove the back two rubber feet to get to the screws there. The only thing I miss from my previous is the backlit keyboard. While the top is not a purple color like some reviewers claim, I wasn't a fan of the swirly plastic so I vinyl wrapped it.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: High performance laptop for $650, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about a $500+ laptop, then after reading few reviews and research I ordered this baby. Along with 1. Crucial 8GB Single DDR4 2400 MT/s (PC4-19200) DR x8 SODIMM 260-Pin Memory - CT8G4SFD824A (ASIN: B019FREJOQ) 2. ADATA SU800 M.2 2280 256GB Ultimate 3D NAND Solid State Drive (ASU800NS38-256GT-C) (ASIN: B01M3Z46FQ) It took 10-15 minutes to install additional 8G memory and SSD. This thing is faster than many $1,000 laptops, and looks and feels amazing. If you don't plan to upgrade RAM and SSD don't buy it, it's just under configured as shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjeev

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Within months I have issues with this laptop, I used it every few days for browsing and it never left my home. The screen went blank and I had to send it in for repairs. That took ages. Now the tough pad works when it wants to. The mouse moves on it own, and if you try to control the mouse it causes the screen to enlargen or makes everything tiny. Its as if the laptop goes rogue. At this point ive had it too long to return it, so im stuck with it. BTW when bought it, it has maybe 4 - 4/12 stars, now its at 3 stars. :(
customer_reviews.author: A.Regis

customer_reviews.title: Must install SSD
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing once you put an SSD in it. Be super careful to put the case screws back in the exact same spots. I accidently pushed the longer 2 screws through the bottom left corners until I realized my mistake. Now my front side has two screw holes poked through, now covered with electrical tape. No damage to the machine thankfully but be careful to line them all up exactly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey N. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great general purpose laptop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for my daughter's boyfriend. He hasn't had any problems with it. This laptop is a great deal given the good hardware specs and nice looking 1080p screen. Many laptops in this price range only have lower resolution 768p screens. It's very lightweight and compact for a 15-inch laptop. As with any Windows laptop give it some time to install all the Windows 10 updates when you first plug it in. I think some people don't let it finish updating before trying to use it a lot and then they complain it's slow or unresponsive. It's easy to upgrade the hardware on the laptop yourself, such as adding an SSD. Overall highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Overton

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a very good laptop. I upgraded with a Crucial MX300 SSD, but despite what some other reviews say I think the original hard drive is pretty fast. The laptop is very lightweight. The screen is nice and the keyboard is comfortable. The USB ports fit tightly, but I prefer the tight fit. I have nothing bad to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Graham

customer_reviews.title: Extremely capable light laptop.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely capable, lightweight, decent battery life with good WiFi and Bluetooth functionality. I wish the battery lasted just a bit longer but at this price point you really can’t be too picky about that. I would have happily paid an extra $50-80 for another hour of life though :) I have been building and gaming on computers for many years now, Asus is probably my favorite company for reliability recently.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Jones

customer_reviews.title: If it were not for Microsoft, this would be a great machine
customer_reviews.text: A great performer, with great visuals. Also, lightweight and compact but not like some MACs. Long battery life, too. What I disliked the most is the Microsoft software, As much as they boast about Windows 10 it is fraught with problems, just as much as all the other Windows before it. Help? You must jump through hoops when finally you get a live person to chat with, to find out that your problem is not his/her expertize and transfers you to another department. Naturally, you lose the connection with the transfer and you start again from square one.
customer_reviews.author: Kupciher

customer_reviews.title: If I could give the laptop a 0 rating, I would!
customer_reviews.text: Many difficulties with slow processing since I purchased this in January, 2019. The final straw was the motherboard blowing after only 3 months, as verified by my computer repairman. Called ASUS who would honor the warranty and repair it, but I have no more patience. Unfortunately, I was out of the window to return for a full refund and will lose a $100 restocking fee. In all fairness, Amazon offered to send me a new one, but I am just done!. DO NOT BUY THIS LAPTOP!
customer_reviews.author: Val Shaner

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with an SSD but the issues far out weigh the benefits
customer_reviews.text: First Issue I had happened about two weeks after purchase. I started hearing a clicking noise from my laptop. After replacing the harddrive with an SSD that issue was fixed. Not even a year later I am now getting a line that appears on the screen when I open the screen, I can get rid of it my wiggling the screen so look like I will need to replace either the screen or the cable if its separate from the screen. The first laptop I bought that I really liked was an ASUS and this one I have really liked as well but all these issues that have arisen have really driven my review down.
customer_reviews.author: Arbitwah

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!  Didn't last 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a present for my son. Today we tried setting it up and after 3 minutes the screen went. Need a refund. This is trash. Update Requested a refund and I'm being told to return it for a replacement. Not interested. Based on the reviews this laptop is no good.
customer_reviews.author: Shellyann McMahon

customer_reviews.title: Here's how to make it SCREAM.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Amazon Warehouse, like new i5-8250, 8gb ram, 1tb hdd, IPS Display, fingerprint sensor for $329. I installed a Crucial MX500 1TB 3D NAND SATA M.2 Type 2280SS Internal SSD - CT1000MX500SSD4 I also installed 2x8gb HyperX 2400mhz cl14 memory. Dont bother buying memory any faster, it won't be utilized. This computer has worked flawlessly and feels more solid than the previous ASUS F556 i5-7200u. And that was over 5 lbs with an aluminum keyboard surround deck. Btw, including my upgrades, my total is still only $485. If I'd have paid for new (which mine basically is) without upgrades, as you can see, it would be $729.
customer_reviews.author: draggedinbycat

customer_reviews.title: Slow where it shouldnt be and many "features" just dont work.
customer_reviews.text: Its slow. I mean really slow at times. It takes over a minute at times just to get to the log in screen. Most of that time spent at POST. Makes no sense. Then the fingerprint scanner only works about 5% of the time(why even bother?) Finally , after at least a few mins you get use the computer. I removed windows and reinstalled a fresh copy with no bloat software from the manufacturer and its still just a turd.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is about half/screen dies
customer_reviews.text: I got this item only recently because I needed a laptop. It says 8 hours for battery life, but I got 4 working hours after I charged it to full 100%. It also only comes with windows 10 free for only 30 days, I read it as if it was included. I am not sure if that is correct or not, but when I started the laptop it told me 30 days free and after that it would be $99. Overall its nice, but its not fully capable of all that is described. 11/18/19 almost a year from when I bought it the screen died. It will cost almost $200 to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Sabiduria60

customer_reviews.title: Bought two - over DELL
customer_reviews.text: DELL let me down on the hinges. ASUS had to pick up the slack. These are awesome, tough, capable notebooks for the price! Hinges. Hinges. Hinges. The hinges on this notebook are tough, well made, and is really a hinge that goes almost completely from side to side. DELL makes some this way, but - not all. Really like this model of ASUS. And, will be extra careful from on - and not just trust DELL because of their name/reputation.
customer_reviews.author: armssDOTnet

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money, but it has issues.
customer_reviews.text: Sent the wrong color compared to what is shown in the image, not a big deal but I'd prefer to get what I paid for. The performance isn't very good with the stock HDD, but I added my own SSD and now it performs better across the board. The only big complaint I have is the keyboard. I've had cheaper laptops with better keyboards than this. The key travel is trash, materials are extremely cheap, and I'm having issues with some of the key caps popping off. Hopefully I'll be able to come up with my own fix for the key caps, because I really don't feel like dealing with customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: The speakers are better than any laptops I've had
customer_reviews.text: *This review assumes you have installed an SSD* Absolute work horse of a laptop. I have spent an average of 3 hours a day on it, and it had kept up with everything I need. The display is absolutely gorgeous and makes watching videos a dream. The speakers are better than any laptops I've had, and makes it clear to hear anything you are playing. Laptop rarely gets hot, the battery is pretty long lasting, and the form factor is just amazing and light. Only complaint I would have isn fingerprint sensor is very small and often requires a retry to unlock using finger print.
customer_reviews.author: John Dembeck

customer_reviews.title: So far I found the computer great. It didn’t come with too much bloat wear
customer_reviews.text: I just brought this for my son (9 years old) and will update this if anything changes. So far I found the computer great. It didn’t come with too much bloat wear, and there’s plenty of room to install games still. I ran Hearthstone and Overwatch on it and both look good and neither show any signs of lag or low FPS. The computer itself is a really deep grey that almost looks purplish in some lights. It’s very light and easy to carry. The keyboard and sound all seem like the typical laptop so far. The touchpad mouse works just like any other, but I did get a mouse for my son to use.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: it feels painful. With an SSD
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this unless you plan on installing an SSD. Without an SSD, it feels painful. With an SSD, super snappy. I bought a Crucial SSD ($70) which included disk cloning. Here are a few installation tips: The screws on the base of the laptop are different lengths. Make sure you keep track of which screws go where You need to remove two of the laptop "feet" to access two of the screws The Crucial SSD SW said to remove the old drive after install, but instead I just selected the new boot disk from BIOS. Hold F2 when booting This is a great value, but I don't understand why Acer didn't include an SSD
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReviewer001

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Student Laptop Especially if on Sale
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice deal if you manage to get it on sale, I got it for about 500 which for the price (after upgrading to an SSD) was a banger deal. Installing the ssd was pretty simple but did show the low build quality which for a 500 dollar laptop you would hope for some better materials but everything else is pretty good. Only other gripe is the battery runs out pretty quickly. As a student laptop this is pretty perfect but don't buy this expecting it to be a game Slayer or anything. What it can do it does very well.
customer_reviews.author: Gabecortes00

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop at an awesome price
customer_reviews.text: Actually when I purchased it, after endlessly looking at another hundreds here on amazon, I'm not sure what was going on but there were only a few units left. Bought it at about 590$ plus tax...that was last May, now i see is almost 800 for the 15" so I am obviously beyond happy. This is not my main laptop and surely I wouldn't recommend for gaming (hence the 2 stars) etc...but is perfect for work and standard activities or as a spare laptop. And is Asus which still means top quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M.

customer_reviews.title: Decent of the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought is because it had decent specs for its price and it is much lighter than other models or brands I found in this price range. I mainly use it for school work and basic browsing and it has been working perfectly fine. One recommendation I have is that buy m.2 sdd and plug it in. There is a port for it in the laptop. The hard drive it comes with is slow. You will notice a huge difference when you make the change. Also the camera is not that good. If you are big into video conferencing, than you might want to look at buying an external cam. Other than that, its a good laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Kunal

customer_reviews.title: First laptop dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Had to exchange the first laptop as it wasn't working at all when it arrived. The second laptop I got looked different from the first and the picture on amazon. It was supposed to be silver and smooth, but instead its a blue matte texture. The second laptop has the same specs but I still am very disappointed in this purchase. I hope my replacement laptop lasts, it doesn't boast well for ASUS that I got a dead on arrival product from them.
customer_reviews.author: W. R

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a personal business computer, easy to set up, good clarity, fairly light and thin. Once using more often the screen went out (still able to use with monitors) and spoke with Customer Support ( both Amazon's & Asus) and sent back to Asus to fix. Was returned pretty quickly and issue was fixed. Spoke with Asus customer service again with questions, very helpful and was able to assist with my inquiry easily. Also went onto Asus website to troubleshoot and very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: ME now

customer_reviews.title: SDD upgrade is an absolute must
customer_reviews.text: Its great AFTER you put a SSD in it. If you don't have the ability to know how to do so, don't even bother. The HDD is so slow, it makes the laptop almost unusable. "MAXIMUS-VERGONIUS" made a great review about how to do so, but I will note that mine did not have a screw inside. I used one of the short ones from the bottom cover in the meantime. Also, be careful as the power button is on the keyboard where I'm used to the delete button is. That'll get some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Smoking 8 gen with huge potential
customer_reviews.text: Added a SSD to the empty slot, 8 gb of ram to ANOTHER empty slot, now I have a 8gen i5 with 250 GB SSD, 1 tb hdd for storage, and 16 gb of ram. I'll trade that for touchscreen and a disk drive any day.
customer_reviews.author: eddie w

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to use this laptop, but unfortunately, it fell short on my expectations. The Battery life lasted a total of maybe 3 hours on a good day. The computer was slow, and not sure if I got a lemon out of the bunch but the trackpad hardly worked and would always jitter the mouse around the screen. The materials on this laptop felt cheap and unreliable over all I did not have a good experience with this laptop and I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Royce

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a secondary pc, travel friendly with good performance, quiality and looks.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a graphic designer and this is a great purchase. The screen resolution is really good and I love the nano edge display. Also the fact that it's so light weight is perfect for me since I travel a lot with it. It also has a very good look. My design programs run smoothly and the performance overall is really good for a good price. I wish it had ethernet and cd port, but that's not really a must for me. I have a desktop computer and this is perfect for me when I need to take my work with me, not sure if I would settle for this as an all-timer. Still, it does as advertised all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Valeria Bonilla

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a year, battery life not what advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for work and school, just months after the return window closed the USB port on the right side of the laptop stopped working and just months later less than a year of owning it the laptop motherboard died and will no longer boot, would not recommend this product to anyone, furthermore it boasts an 8 hour battery life, under any type of light load you would be lucky to get even half that from it, absolutely poor quality product from a brand I previously trusted, sadly I cannot RMA or return it due to not being in the United States and buying the product through a mail forwarder, I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chevon-Wayne Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Very good with m.2 SSD
customer_reviews.text: Huge difference with m.2 SSD. I have used it for ~10 months without the m.2 SSD and was getting frustrated. After I installed the 256GB Crucial, totally different experience. I strongly recommend installing m.2 SSD at least if you want to save some money and not replacing the hdd. The installation took about 20 mins and cloning depends on how much you want to clone. Use plastic trim removal tool for removing the cover. I gave it 4 stars for: 1. hiding 2 screws behind rubber legs. 2. not including the m.2 SATA SSD screw. 3. locating the Power button next to the Delete button.
customer_reviews.author: Casual Player

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Laptop for the price...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good, well built Laptop.. But for me and everyone else who buys this laptop, you have to replace the 5400rpm traditional hard drive (which are essentially obsolete), with either a M2. or a regular SSD drive.. I've been using this laptop for 2-1/2 weeks deciding if I was going to keep it or not.. It's performed Fantastic, no issues at all.. Now that I decided to keep it I will replace the hard drive, and 2 8GB sticks of memory I've had laying around, for the last year that I took out of a laptop I bought a year ago..
customer_reviews.author: TimeSpaceGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop for U$ 500
customer_reviews.text: I've followed the recommendation from another user and also bought an SSD (500Gb Sata M.2). Installed without any problems (following a quick video on youtube).... and this machine ROCKS !!! powers up and have windows up and running in less than 15 seconds... opens apps quickly... transfer files fast... So far (less than 48 hours since I've started using) I'm sold: 5 STARS !!!... more updates to come...
customer_reviews.author: LC-VIrginia

customer_reviews.title: Placement of the Power & Delete keys!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop has been good so far, and no issues with its general operating system. However the keyboard isnt able to illuminate and the power button is placed in a very unproductive spot in the top right corner of the keyboard right next to the delete button, which has proven to be a hindrance for the user/ myself hitting the power button accidentally. Its lightweight design is nice, but I wish I would have researched this more as far as functionality before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Shellie&Mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice 8th Gen i5 laptop with $500 budget
customer_reviews.text: From this price point the PROS are 1. Nice Anti glare screen. Good color pixels 2. 8th Gen i5 processor. Quite fast booting after adding M2 SSD. 3. Build quality is good. Do have cheap things. Look like premium laptop. CONS 1. Battery can be improved. 8th gen i5 is optimized to consume less power but it does not reflect in this laptop 2. Don't like the key board design . Initially i thought mine is a defective one then cam to know this is chiclet keyboard. I was about to return the laptop considering the center portion of the laptop is pressed below. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-priced laptop.
customer_reviews.text: Got this too replace my seven-year-old Asus, which was the longest-lived laptop I've ever owned. I had high expectations, and so far this has been great. Fast enough for me, with great storage and a nice display. Backlit keys are somewhat of a problem because the actual symbols in the keys are hard to read. And the documentation for this laptop was mostly nonexistent. All in all a though, I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John F.D. Taff

customer_reviews.title: careful what you buy
customer_reviews.text: I was unpleasantly surprised to see so few ports. Then what really shocked me was that there is no port for direct wire connection to my internet in my home office! I had to suffer lack of internet connection because of a failure of mt internet booster in the center of our home. All in all, it is a disappointing purchase. Never again. I will stick to my HP or Dell laptops before leaving entirely for an Apple one. In the meantime I hope someone will tell me if there is a way to wire connect my internet to this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: baraitna

customer_reviews.title: Black screen after minimal usage: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS LAPTOP. We bought one in February, I got it configured and we essentially put it in our "travel drawer" until my wife left for Bogota, Colombia this week for 5 days of business meetings. I double-checked everything befrore she left. She arrived at the hotel, set it up, went downstairs briefly, came back to the room and the screen was BLACK. So she had a useless brick/doorstop for her business meetings and had to do whatever she could on her phone. Now that she's back there is no solution in sight.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce MacEwen

customer_reviews.title: Nice computer that doesn’t break the bank
customer_reviews.text: From what I could find this computer is the best you can get for the price. The screen flexes the smallest amount (which if that’s a concern just look up YouTube videos and you can see what I mean) it’s not bad. The keys kinda give more than say a hp but I kinda like it. I haven’t trying the sound yet but I heard from reviews it’s not the best . For me it’s not an issue. I got this computer for edits pictures and videos, college, and just to have a nice computer that doesn’t break the bank. For me so far after setting everything up it’s everything I needed
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Functions as described.
customer_reviews.text: It's a windows laptop and works as described. I had to disable the Microsoft Edge that piece of software is so intrusive and non-functional for me. It's crazy that you have to go to the settings to tell it to open PDF files in a PDF software. Other quirky things like that to learn. But the touch pad is a REAL touch pad, no clicking needed, just touch !
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Good Laptop for a good price point
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded this laptop to 16GB Memory and upgraded the OS to Windows 10 Pro, the 8th Gen I5 (Quad Core) is a capable processor and does all I need, this Laptop is being used as a dedicated AstroPhotography control computer. Other then the vendor (Sunrise Technologies & Trading Corp.) sending me the wrong Laptop and having to return it and then waiting to receive the replacement all is AOK with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L.

customer_reviews.title: Best Features for the Buck laptop available
customer_reviews.text: Best Features for the Buck laptop available. Pros: Quad core Coffee-Lake CPU. M.2, 2.5" drive bay and memory sockets easily accessible under the bottom panel. Thin-bezel IPS screen! Cons: It's always sold out now. Other thoughts: Only improvements I can think of are additional models that offer an SSD, back-lit keyboard, and maybe a better IPS screen
customer_reviews.author: Balsamic Vinaigrette

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy!!! Black Screen after two days
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Laptop as I am a big fan of Asus laptops. Within two days of getting this laptop the screen went dark. I have to connect a secondary monitor to it to be able to use it. I have gone through all the troubleshooting steps and still nothing. Returned it for another one and after a few days the same problem occurred. Shipped the device International and Asus is telling me that I have to have a US address in order for them to be able to offer any kind of assistance. NOT RECOMMENDED.
customer_reviews.author: Rohan

customer_reviews.title: Excruciating, a real hair puller
customer_reviews.text: Bought this laptop for my kids. My 10 year old doesn't even want to use it now because its so slow. We haven't loaded any apps for the most part. She uses the school provide chrome book, which performs better than this P.O.S. It's barely used and its still slow. I have no patience for slow laptops and now because of the remote learning I cannot put my children through this crap of working with a slow laptop.
customer_reviews.author: T.M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little laptop
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our son, it works fine, needs to be cleaned (disk cleanup) regularly but that isn't the laptops fault it's the websites he visits, the only thing is there is no dvd player. It is small and the graphics aren't that good but we feel we got our money's worth and I like ASUS. I have a great gaming laptop from them that I have put through the ringer for two years and then another that is 10 years old that I gave a grandson.
customer_reviews.author: C. Farley

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: We bought one of these for our daughter, after an old laptop bit the dust. We already had a 2.5" SATA SSD from the old one that was recently upgraded, so I replaced the new hard drive with it...thanks to the steps and warnings from the other folks here on what to look out for. It's only had a day of use so far, but it's been great. The display is bright despite the anti-glare, performance is peppy, the device is light, and the keyboard feels very similar to my MBP keyboard. The one feature I wish it had, was a backlit keyboard. With that it would be the cat's meow.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Junk Computer
customer_reviews.text: I am completely dissatisfied with the manufacturer's resolution and policy for a defective product to the problem I am having with the laptop's monitor. The computer functions with an external monitor but not the laptop's screen. There is a diagnosis fee to have the laptop checked and then a servicing center would have to make the repair. At an unknown cost to me to make the repair. We have other ASUS products. This is extremely disappointing. An award winning company should stand behind their product. I wish I could have been a glowing review.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bush

customer_reviews.title: The computer became like 5x faster
customer_reviews.text: This gets 5 stars if you install an SSD. The computer became like 5x faster. Boots in 6 seconds. I hope this doesn't keep them from honoring their warranty. I got the WD and it works great, this one:  There's some incorrect info in these reviews. The SSD must be type "SATA M.2 2280", NOT NVME.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Penitent

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop with good price
customer_reviews.text: I am using this laptop for 2-3 weeks and i like it. First 1-2 days it was slow(windows updates) at the beginning but after disabling "windows search" service it was back to normal and no more %100 hdd usage. I still want to replace hdd with ssd anyway, so ssd+1 tb hdd will make this a future proof laptop. Screen is really good and after installing "asus splendid utility" application it gets better. Cons are no back light with keyboard and no caps lock light. But for money i paid for it, it is a good buy. I recommend it to everyone..
customer_reviews.author: ORCUN NAMLI

customer_reviews.title: Don’t order, I’d give zero stars if i could.
customer_reviews.text: After 10 months, repeated crashing and BSOD errors. Very difficult to received any customer support via Asus and Amazon. Be warned, no help to be had. Total waste of $$. Update: After numerous hours on the phone with this company, still no resolution to my problem. I have spent time via chat and on the phone with tech support without success. I have returned my device to ASUS multiple times for service. Shame on ASUS and shame on Amazon. A complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: nicksmom

customer_reviews.title: Nice light weight laptop
customer_reviews.text: Really nice laptop, I like the thin chassis and light weight. Easily fits in a briefcase. For a basic PC laptop it's good value for the money. I will eventually install an SSD to speed up the performance. It is ever so slightly sluggish but I think that's due to the spinning hard drive, which is common. It doesn't have much bloatware which is helpful. Overall a recommended buy for light duty computing.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Brakebill

customer_reviews.title: But is it SUPER light-weight, my 13' Macbook Pro weighs twice as ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been using it much, since I got it specially for doing Digital Forensics examinations. But is it SUPER light-weight, my 13' Macbook Pro weighs twice as much. The SPECs are good, its even faster since I added an additional 8B RAM, making it a total of 16GB. The 15" screen is big and nice, this will make my examinations go much faster. Only drawback is...it's a PAIN-IN-THE-A$$ to open even after removing all the screws. Also, I'm not a FAN of the Delete and Power button being next to each other, now I see what the other people are complaining about accidentally shutting it off. DISADVANTAGE of Amazon Seller, it was delivered to my USPS NOT MY HOME.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly - Ann Parkinson

customer_reviews.title: Returning it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for school with low expectations. The system is about 7 hours old, has all of its updates and is having issues. the OS takes about a minute to load, during light use it stops responding, then resumes at random. It has a Toshiba HDD so I downloaded their diagnostic tool. It cannot recognize the HDD. Asus, I love you but I am not going to risk my academic future with a laptop that needs troubleshooting before I can get word installed. This thing is being factory reset, and being returned. My apologies.
customer_reviews.author: A. G. Crivello

customer_reviews.title: Screen flickering and unusable after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I did alot of research on laptops and chose this one to run my business. After only 9 months, there is a screen flicker, halo and double imaging. I've tried everything to fix from home and now must send back to ASUS to be repaired. ASUS customer service is awful, they don't help at all over the phone, and I must send it back for at least 2 weeks. I RUN MY BUSINESS FROM THIS COMPUTER, I don't have 2 weeks. They won't offer a loaner and don't care.
customer_reviews.author: wdjacobs

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine until 1 year warranty expired, then screen died
customer_reviews.text: We had absolutely no complaints about this laptop until 2 weeks after the 1 year warranty expired. The screen does not come on at all. It works on an external screen. We are trying all of the suggestions we found online but none seem to answer the problem. Our next step is to open up the screen area to make sure that all with wires are connected and then to try replacing the screen itself.
customer_reviews.author: PatriciaD

customer_reviews.title: Monitor died
customer_reviews.text: The reason I am writing this review is so I can get in touch with the ASUS people in order to help with my situation, I bought the computer and with in 2 week of use the monitor stopped working, the computer does work with an external monitor, but it takes the purpose of a laptop. Please make contact with me so I can enjoy my new laptop properly.
customer_reviews.author: Folker Hanze

customer_reviews.title: Light and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This has been a really good computer for the money. It is fast and lightweight. It has plenty of power for most tasks. I use office based programs mostly and do lots of researching on this computer. I don’t game, so not idea how that would go, but it’s probably not bad. The only thing I don’t like is that the power button sits beside the delete key. It’s getting better, but occasionally when it was new I would accidentally turn it off. That was a little annoying, but adapt and overcome as they say. It’s a good system and has loads of space available for storage:
customer_reviews.author: J.M. Myrick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is a great value. I installed SSDs in both slots so it runs extremely fast. The build quality, while plastic is very good. It is lightweight, sturdy, and has an excellent screen. The GPU is not premium but I occasionally run games like CS:GO on Steam with no issue. It charges fast and lasts about 5 hours with heavy use. I run many programs like Visual Studio for school and DAWs like Cakewalk to play my guitar and write music and it performs flawlessly. I haven't had a single hiccup in the few months I've owned this laptop. It is an excellent PC for the value once you upgrade the memory and storage.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: 2 years later...
customer_reviews.text: so I've had a bit of bogging down on this laptop with nowhere close to extensive use, but het. it looks great and its super light. I've started to hear a weird "click/snap" sound when I push the screen to open or close. I'm also getting Lehighton bleeding around the bottom edge of the display, but its expected after 2+ years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kimani

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Cheap quality build and terrible experience overall. Initial setup stage crashed the laptop due to memory address not found. Subsequently, multiple crashes seen when trying to upgrade Windows 10. Ultimately, unable to get past boot screen. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: DD13

customer_reviews.title: A super nice laptop for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a super nice laptop for the money. Solid specs and Asus typically delivers quality. It's not loaded with a ton of bloatware but there is some in there like any other OEM system but that's easy enough to do away with using the Windows system refresh tool. It was easy to add a Solid State Drive after getting the cover off. Take your time and use something plastic to nudge the edges along. Also note that the two base pads nearest the rear hinge have screws underneath them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nope

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, great picture and sound, fast laptop
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this laptop for nursing school. It is lightweight which is exactly what I was looking for since I have to carry it from class to class. The picture and sound is great. The battery lasts for a long time. It boots up quickly every time I turn it on. Only thing that it is lacking is a Ethernet port but luckily I haven’t had any issues with it picking up WiFi at school. Overall, I am very pleased with this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Davis

customer_reviews.title: Computer failed after two years of light use
customer_reviews.text: Product failed after two years. The hard drive developed bad sections and the computer slowed until it was completely unusable. A computer should last more than two years.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for less than 90 days. I have used it maybe 15 times for short periods. Has already stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: MyDogKobe

customer_reviews.title: No world wide warranty
customer_reviews.text: Bought to my teenager son to be used for school tasks . Less that 5 months it stopped to work. As we live ouvir seas , I did not get lever seas repair . Luckily y I had to come back to USA , I could sent to warranty repair. Than a friend brought to me months later . If you liver out side , consider this . Computer is great .
customer_reviews.author: Cristiano Goulart

customer_reviews.title: adding a SSD will solve the slow HDD problem for around $90 (it is great to have 250G +1T storage)
customer_reviews.text: a steal for this price ($500), adding a SSD will solve the slow HDD problem for around $90 (it is great to have 250G +1T storage). The laptop feels a bit flimsy, as others said, it is all plastic. Bottom-line is, it is light, cheap and expandable ... i dont care much about back-lit keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Fung

customer_reviews.title: One of the best budget conscious quad core laptop
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop ..bang for the buck. Great review by MAXIMUS-VERGONIUS. used his pics to upgrade to SSD via the m2 slot and now the boot up time is 10-12 sec. These new laptops have the latest 8th gen core i5 chips which are quad core (4 cores and 8 threads) these are powerful chips and by increasing RAM and SSD they are really capable computers.
customer_reviews.author: Manish Acharya

customer_reviews.title: Just Bad
customer_reviews.text: I've been an ASUS fan for more than a decade but this was just bad. I recommended this to my boyfriend based on the past great experience I had with ASUS but on arrival the charger won't charge the laptop. It kept saying charger not supported. Contacted ASUS but it took them forever to respond through e-mail. Thankfully I was able to return it back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Trina94

customer_reviews.title: Motherboard Died
customer_reviews.text: I was loving my new Asus laptop and then my motherboard died. It has been at the Asus repair facility for over a month and a half. The status on the Asus self service website keeps changing, but it see isn't getting repaired. I called Asus two weeks ago and they said it would be fixed in 3 business days. Still no updated or laptop. The kicker is that I was two months past my warranty date.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Computer is good, but sound is horrible! Cannot hear without earphones
customer_reviews.text: I like the computer fine...nothing special, but satisfactory for my needs. However, the sound is horrific! Absolutely NO VOLUME AT ALL. Must use earphones when watching movies or anything with sound. The worse EVER!! Had to buy a speaker. Also, keyboard is wonky. Just touch and it moves around. Had to return first one as it would not charge after 2 months. Replacement very easy with Amazon. Wish I'd spent a little more and got an ACER. I've had 3 and all were much better. Would not buy an ASUS again.
customer_reviews.author: linda blackmore

customer_reviews.title: Design defect scratches screen
customer_reviews.text: Overall the laptop is good, although I added an extra 8gb of ram and a SSD. The screen is quite nice. However, the slight wiggle (1-2mm perhaps) in the hinges causes the lid to 'vibrate' against the keyboard. The screen touches the strip between the spacebar and the track pad, which has left a number of tiny scratches on the otherwise great screen. I really care about the display quality, so this is quite irritating. I wish I had gotten a quality screen protector.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work fairly well so far. I popped ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fairly well so far. I popped a 256gb crucial ssd in there. Just be careful you get the right one and you install it correctly. System fan runs an awful lot though even when just light internet browsing with one tab. I used an Asus midrange system in the past and have had problems with heat so I hope this one doesn’t turn out the same. Seems to only have a single fan that vents out near the hinge.
customer_reviews.author: bookalot23

customer_reviews.title: Ram + SSD = Awesome Vivobook.
customer_reviews.text: In simple terms, add a solid state drive and plug in more ram. Watch the you tube video on unscrewing the bottom plate and prying it apart with a credit card or guitar pick first. Use Macrium reflect home use free to clone to the SSD and spinning HDD becomes storage...complete things with a mouse and padded laptop bag. Now you won the game!
customer_reviews.author: tunatony

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I have used this computer a handful of times since my purchase in April of 2019. The computer simply does not work. Windows does not put through automatic updates like it should and does on all my other PCs. This is my 4th ASUS laptop and have always had great experiences with them until this one. This is the worst computer I have ever purchased. It is the slowest computer I have ever seen for the specs. I use this laptop for browsing the web...that's it. I am in the process of contacting ASUS support. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, fast, enough storage and built with quality
customer_reviews.text: After thorough research of the top laptops in the $500 range, I finally decided with the Vivobook. This is my first ASUS device and I am confident my money was spent wisely. 8GB ram is more than enough for everything minus gaming. The 8th gen i5 is very fast and smooth. Overall the laptop is well built and very light. I think this is the best possible laptop in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Best laptop I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Great features and super fast: Things I normally don't see in a laptop, but this one is that and more. You MUST replace the HDD with an SSD for great performance, but it's worth the investment. My only negative comment is that, per manufacturer's instructions, I needed to rip out two of the rubber feet on the base to access screws required to open the case to upgrade storage. All the prying caused me to scratch the finish on the base of my brand new laptop. This issue had me down for a while (why do I need to damage a brand-new laptop to upgrade it?!?!?) but once I got over it, it has been smooth sailing!
customer_reviews.author: zac

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Chromebook half-way through college when my laptop of six years stopped working. It's a great little device to carry in a backpack and to travel with. Has excellent battery life and works efficiently with a dozen tabs open at the same time. Not compatible with all software...but if you need something to write papers and watch netflix on this will do the trick. My friends & family are all surprised by how lightweight it is.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great so far
customer_reviews.text: I'm an engineering student and needed something that could handle running heavy programs. Also you can watch videos in 4k which is nice. Haven't had any issues yet so pretty glad I chose this.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality computer
customer_reviews.text: Can’t go wrong with an ASUS!! Great quality computer. Some of the reviews here mention that the touchpad didn’t work well. I suspect they hadn’t fully charged it prior to trying to use it the first time. It specifically says to charge for a minimum of 3 hours before using. I tried to use it before that time and had the same problem. I plugged it back in, let it fully charge as directed and have had no problems since. I sort of wished it had a number pad but it is overall a great buy and I decided that I didn’t use the number pad enough to justify spending a lot more just for that.
customer_reviews.author: A.Teach

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good daily laptop. Not fastest but enough RAM and CPU.
customer_reviews.text: For all of the memory and CPU it preforms add expected but takes a bit of time to access the HDD since it's not ssd. Takes three to five minutes to boot and load. I'm using low impact virus protection which still takes while to load all services. The screen is full HD as stated. And the touchpad works well. The keyboard isn't the best but get a cheap rubber cover and that should help. For am i5 generation 8, higher graphics programs like Photoshop work adequately but the graphics card isn't high end so there can be lag time.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Larry

customer_reviews.title: Monitor not working after 2 weeks of usage
customer_reviews.text: Extremely Disappointed as monitor will not come on although power button light is on. Upon viewing Asus support page recommendation is that i remove Lithium batteries and use ac adapter to charge as the "Power light is on " indicates that "Power cord and ac adapter are working but the device fails to boot due to disfunction of other major components " I have not had a month of usage and yet i am already experiencing issues due to design or manufacturing errors. Do not buy definitely not worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Nyrel

customer_reviews.title: The computer works fine. If you want to charge it
customer_reviews.text: The computer works fine. If you want to charge it, you will have to hold it in place or it just falls right out of the hole. It appers as though it is not even made to fit into the power socket. Customer service is making me pay to send back the cord and will hopefull send me one that is acutually supposted to go with the computer or at least works, but who knows if the next one will be the same piece of junk they sent the first time. Personally, I wish I had never ordered it and would not recommand.
customer_reviews.author: OhDear623

customer_reviews.title: A lightweight, thin, fast and reliable laptop!
customer_reviews.text: I bought another ASUS about four years ago. It was a bit heavier. As the years rolled by it proved to be stable and reliable, and I began to really trust the ASUS brand. This one is no different. It is lighter and thinner than the last, but faster. I use it to teach English around the world using Skype. I also design websites and use it for Photoshop, Illustrator, and Video editing.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Fast- lightweight- stylish- responsive- all around a good buy. Hassle free for weeks so far, and able to handle all requirements with ease. Comfortable typing design (slant) and gentle feel. A pleasure to use and equipped with all the bells I was needing. Everything from blue tooth to programming has been an incredibly trouble-free experience. Highly recommend it to others. For me, it's been fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: DONALD ROGERS

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Cheap laptop, but it has excellent quality. I recommend getting an SSD card. It will make your laptop way faster. Make sure you clone the hard disk to the SSD using Macrium or Acronis. then make the laptop boot from the SSD and if it works well, just format the slow disk.
customer_reviews.author: adriantorres89

customer_reviews.title: Slower than 5+ year old laptop, but everything else - great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade my Sony pentium dual processor laptop which is 5+ years old. Everything on this laptop is nice except one thing - the drive seems pretty slow. I did a clean install of windows 10 on this and it still feels a noticeable amount slower than my older, inferior laptop. So I would recommend anyone getting this to consider replacing the drive with a SSD. For comparison. Sony pentium dual process, 3GB ram, mechanical drive, windows 7. This laptop, quad-core, 8GB ram, mechanical drive, windows 10. I'm not really happy my 5+ old laptop is faster than a latest generation laptop, but everything else besides speed is nice.
customer_reviews.author: notebook_buyer

customer_reviews.title: Had for 45 minutes and screen went dark!
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for an hour and the screen already went dark. I can barely see the screen and no troubleshooting has worked! Who do I talk to about a return? What a shame!! I'm very upset.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Roach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect laptop
customer_reviews.text: Recently went back to school so I needed a laptop to do homework and web surfing. I ordered this not knowing much about laptops. I never heard of this brand but went with it based on reviews and the monthly payment option. Once it arrived, I was impressed on how light and slick it is. Set up was easy and it’s fast enough for my needs. I am satisfied with the purchase. I got a protection plan as well since I did not know the brand. Only small things I would add to make it better is keyboard backlight and touch screen capabilities but those are not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: AlwaysShopping23

customer_reviews.title: broken on first day of class
customer_reviews.text: bought Feb 20, 2019. Today, Aug 26, 2019 is day one of college. It worked over the weekend and today, it's on with a black screen. Cannot do the hard boot as described on the site and ASUS has NO live operators. Only chat, but if you don't have an existing case to note in a field, you're kicked out. Not happy at all!
customer_reviews.author: M & J

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sharp monitor, good price
customer_reviews.text: Ditch the old style mechanical hard drive and install an SSD and you have a powerful computer. I use this as a backup laptop in case the main one fails. The monitor is outstanding... very crisp. The fingerprint reader is nice too. Feels very sturdy and I have used Asus laptops for years running 24/7.
customer_reviews.author: Construction Dude

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: 1) The material quality is good for the price. 2) The sound is awful Main Problem: The "@" which should appear when you press SHIFT + 2 does not work; instead the result is the quotation sign ("). To get the "@" you have to SHIFT + ' (apostrophy sign). Hence those two keys are misplaced.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Nice laptop for the price, terrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: The laptop is really nice looking and not too heavy. However, the battery life is nowhere near the 8-hour mark that the sticker on the laptop claims. I gave it a try for 3 days, even the the maximum power savings on and 75% CPU utilization, estimated battery life with 98% full was 4 hours 14 minutes and with 56% full, the estimate was a disappointing 39 minutes. Obviously something is not right about this laptop and I cannot play around with it for too long, I have job to do. I will return this, otherwise a nice laptop, with much disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Asm

customer_reviews.title: Best laptop I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Though I prefer a smaller laptop, the performance totally outweighs the size. This one is faster and has a lot more storage space than I've had before. My previous laptop was an ASUS and lasted five years - longer than any other laptop I've ever had. I am much more productive with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Deuel

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: When it worked it was great, but it continually froze. After a week of aggravation i returned it
customer_reviews.author: robert santoro

product_meta.title: ASUS VivoBook F510UA 15.6” Full HD Nanoedge Laptop, Intel Core i5-8250U Processor, 8GB DDR4 RAM, 1TB HDD, USB-C, Fingerprint, Windows 10 Home - F510UA-AH51, Star Gray
product_meta.description: Style:15.6" | Core i5 | 1TB HDDThe ASUS Vivo Book F510UA is the perfect combination of performance and function. The F510UA is a Windows 10 laptop powered by an 8th Generation Intel Core i5-8250U processor, 8GB DDR4 RAM, and ASUS Nano Edge display technology. It's the ideal laptop for daily computing and entertainment. 178 degree wide viewing angle. Bluetooth - Built-in Bluetooth V4.2. Power Adapter - Plug Type : vowels 4 (mm), Output : 19 V DC, 2.47 A, 45 W and Input : 100 -240 V AC, 50/60 Hz universal.
feature_bullets: Powerful 8th Generation Intel Core i5 8250U 1.6GHz (Turbo up to 3.4GHz) processor
14.2 Inches Wide, 0.8 Inches Thin and portable footprint with 0.3 Inches Nano edge bezel for a stunning 80% screen to body ratio
15.6 inches Anti glare full HD display with ASUS splendid software enhancement
Ergonomic chiclet keyboard with fingerprint sensor, Windows 10 Home
Comprehensive connections including USB 3.1 Type C (Gen1), USB 3.0, USB 2.0, and HDMI; Lightning fast 802.11AC Wi Fi keeps you connected through any congestion or interference

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,761 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
